document.masterDocTitle: The subtribes and genera of the tribe Listroderini (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Cyclominae): Phylogenetic analysis with systematic and biogeographical accounts

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The subtribes and genera of the tribe Listroderini (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Cyclominae): Phylogenetic analysis with systematic and biogeographical accounts

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Museo de Zoologia " Alfonso L. Herrera ", Departamento de Biologia Evolutiva, Facultad de Ciencias, Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico (UNAM), Apartado Postal 70 - 399, 04510 Mexico D. F., Mexico

figureCitation.captionText: Figures 27 - 35. Habitus of representative Listroderini. 27 Lanteriella microphtalma 28 Telurus caudiculatus 29 Acrorius papallacta 30 Acrostomus bruchi 31 Antarctobius lacunosus 32 Germainiellus dentipennis 33 Lamiarhinus aelficus 34 Listroderes annulipes 35 Philippius superbus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Listroderes costirostris
Schoenherr , 1826 (by original designation, combined description).
Small to medium-sized (3.9-12.5 mm); vestiture of subcircular scales and setae; scrobal ventral tooth usually present.

Listroderes
is closely related to
Antarctobius, Germainiellus and
the clade Methypora-Rupanius-Acrorius-Trachodema-Lamiarhinus-Philippius . The distinction between
Antarctobius
,
Germainiellus
and
Listroderes
is not without doubt (see Morrone and Marvaldi 1998 ), and future analyses may determine if they are merged into a single genus.

Listroderes apicalis
:
Betavulgaris
L. ( Chenopodiaceae ),
Helianthus annus
L. ( Asteraceae ) and
Triticum aestivum
L. ( Poaceae );
Listroderes bimaculatus
:
Baccharis linearis
(Ruiz and Pav.) Pers. ( Asteraceae ) and
Puya chilensis
Molina ( Bromeliaceae );
Listroderes bruchi
:
Baccharis salicifolia
(Ruiz and Pavon ) Pers. and
Senecio subulatus
Don Hooker et Arnott ( Asteraceae );
Listroderes cinerarius
:
Atriplex
sp. ( Chenopodiaceae );
Listroderes costirostris
,
Listroderes difficilis
and
Listroderes obliquus
:
Apium graveolens
L. and
Daucus carota
L. ( Apiaceae ),
Brassica rapa
L.,
Listroderes oleracea
L. and
Coronopus didymus
(L.) Smith ( Brassicaceae ),
Rumex altissimus
Wood ( Polygonaceae ),
Nicotiana tabacum
L. and
Solanum tuberosum
L. ( Solanaceae ) and
Stellaria
spp. ( Caryophyllaceae );
Listroderes robustus
:
Atriplex semibaccata
R. Br. ( Chenopodiaceae );
Listroderes uruguayensis
:
Hydrocotyle bonariensis
Lam. ( Apiaceae ) ( Morrone 1993d , 1995b; Marvaldi 1998 ; Lanteri et al. 2002 ).

Listroderes bruchi
,
Listroderes delaiguei
and
Listroderes difficilis
( May 1977 , 1993, 1994; Marvaldi 1998 ).

(CBPC, IPCN, IPUM, MACN, MNHN),

(MHNS, MNHN, MZFC),

(CBPC, CWOB, MHNS, MNHN, MZFC),

(AMNH, BMNH, CMNC, MACN, MHNS, MLP, MZFC),

(MHNS),

Listroderes costirostris
complex (AMNH, BMNH, CBPC, CMNC, CWOB, DZUP, FIML, GJWC, MACN, MHNS, MLP, MNHN, MZFC, MZSP, USNM),
Listroderes curvipes
(BMNH, CWOB, MHNS),

(BMNH, CADIC, CWOB, IPUM, MHNS, MZFC),
Listroderes desertorum

(GJWC, MACN, MLP, MNHN),

(MHNS),

(CWOB, MHNS, MZFC),
Listroderes foveatus
(BMNH, CMNC, DZUP, FIML, GJWC, MACN, MZSP),

(BMNH, CWOB, MHNS, MZFC),
Listroderes howdenae
(CMNC, MLP, MZFC),
Listroderes leviculus
(BMNH),
Listroderes montanus
(MHNS, MZFC),
Listroderes nodifer
(BMNH, CWOB, MACN, MHNS),
Listroderes obrieni
(MHNS, MLP, MZFC),
Listroderes paranensis
(DZUP, MNHN),
Listroderes punicola
(CMNC, MHNS, MZFC),
Listroderes pusillus
(CBPC, MLP, MNHN, MZFC),
Listroderes robustior
(BMNH, CMNC, CWOB, MHNS, MLP, MZFC),

(FIML, MLP),

(MHNS),
